intro: Gomesa undulata, commonly known as the wavy gomesia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its attractive, undulating leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Gomesa undulata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
